snippet: James Wasserstrom, whose protracted legal battle with the United Nations ended a nearly 30-year career there, has asked Secretary of State John Kerry for help.
abstract: James Wasserstrom, United Nations whistle-blower who prevailed in landmark case that exposed evidence of retribution against internal criticism but who was awarded only fraction of his claimed financial losses, seeks help from Secretary of State John Kerry, asking him to withhold 15 percent of American government's UN budget allocation.
lead_paragraph: James Wasserstrom, whose protracted legal battle with the United Nations ended a nearly 30-year career there, has asked Secretary of State John Kerry for help.

headline.seo: Aggrieved U.N. Whistle-Blower Seeks Withholding of U.S. Funds
headline.main: Aggrieved U.N. Whistle-Blower Seeks Withholding of American Funds
headline.print_headline: Aggrieved U.N. Whistle-Blower Seeks Withholding of American Funds
